content.body:
> <@npd:mozilla.org> Edge, Chrome, Brave and other browsers based on the same Chromium codebase definitely have different features

 Shouldn't we have different entries for firefox forks and webkit browsers then?

In reply to @npd:mozilla.org
Edge, Chrome, Brave and other browsers based on the same Chromium codebase definitely have different features
 Shouldn't we have different entries for firefox forks and webkit browsers then?

Shouldn't we have different entries for firefox forks and webkit browsers then?
m.new_content.formatted_body:
In reply to npd
Edge, Chrome, Brave and other browsers based on the same Chromium codebase definitely have different features
Shouldn't we have different entries for firefox forks and webkit browsers then?

content.body: every listing site will make its own cut off on which browsers to include, but yeah, those can be separate implementers with different features. I think the trick is that for standards purposes we want to see different implementers, and sometimes that can be multiple browsers with the same underlying engine but with independent implementations of a piece of functionality, but othertimes it's just a single browser engine that has implemented something, and now that functionality appears across multiple browsers
Domenic: thanks for the pointer to that gist; works great. What a funky little namespacing trick.
content.formatted_body: Domenic: thanks for the pointer to that gist; works great. What a funky little namespacing trick.
